Editors' Picks: The International Shakespeare Festival

With the International Shakespeare Festival opening this week, the Arts Editors take a look at what's in store and pick their favourites from the line-up

COSMO: A bargain buffet?

Kayleigh Sutton reviews the marmite of new restaurants in York, COSMO

Review: Avengers: Age of Ultron

Marvel's latest blockbuster is an action-packed delight, says Niall Whitehead

TV Review: Game of Thrones Series 5 Episodes 1 and 2: 'The Wars to Come' and 'The House of Black and White'

The long-awaited return to Westeros promises to be one of Game of Thrones' strongest seasons yet, says Fraser McHale

Review: Vienna Festival Ballet

Despite the high expectations set by the Vienna Festival Ballet, their familiar favourites did not astound. Deborah Lam reviews

Review: Paul Merton's Impro Chums

Based upon audience suggestion, Paul Merton's Impro Chums is an utterly ridiculous improvisation show that will have you laughing from start to finish (and beyond). Lily Papworth reviews.

Review: The Effect

A sensitive and sympathetic exploration of psychological issues, The Effect hits hard. Joel Down reviews Dramasoc's moving interpretation

Hudson Taylor: "Irish artists are really supporting each other"

Alfie Hudson-Taylor, one half of the breakout folk-rock duo, talks busking, music trends and life in a band of brothers

Review: Drums In The Night

As Brecht's early drama is brought to life in the Friargate Theatre, Daniel Bowen reviews York Settlement Players' insightful performance.

TV Review: Mad Men Series 7 Episode 10: 'The Forecast'

Don is increasingly troubled and Betty and Sally meet an old face on Mad Men. Sophie Worning reviews

Review: White God

Dogs rise up against humans in a Hungarian film that manages to be both grippingly entertaining and a disturbingly relevant parable, says Matthew Edwards

TV Review: Gotham Series 1 Episode 17: 'Red Hood'

More potential Jokers appear in another high-quality episode of Gotham, says Niall Whitehead

Festivals 2015: Live @ Leeds Preview

A rundown of the hottest acts playing Live at Leeds this May 2015

Review: Whiplash

eSports at Roses 2015

Adam Koper pays a visit to this year's gaming event

Album Review: Amber Run - 5AM

"With a mix of songs, ranging between the very sad to the euphoric, Amber Run have covered the whole spectrum, without losing their constantly heartfelt core"

TV Review: W1A Series Two Episode One

The BBC's parody of itself returns for a second series. Rhys Thompson reviews W1A.

Album Review: Villagers - Darling Arithmetic

Conor O'Brien a.k.a Villagers seems to have found a Paul Simon-esque ability to translate with disarming simplicity and honesty sentiments that hold universal resonance. Jonathon Hoare reviews
